snippet: A rooster tail of dust billowing out behind it, the gold Lexus climbed into the rugged Mayacamas Mountains. ''Don't be nervous,'' said Jess Jackson, pulling deftly through another hairpin turn. ''I know this country.''    He should; it's the Gauer...
lead_paragraph: A rooster tail of dust billowing out behind it, the gold Lexus climbed into the rugged Mayacamas Mountains. ''Don't be nervous,'' said Jess Jackson, pulling deftly through another hairpin turn. ''I know this country.'' He should; it's the Gauer Ranch, some 75 miles north of San Francisco, one of the last great land holdings in Sonoma County, more than 5,000 acres of mountains, meadows and, yes, vineyards. And Jess Jackson owns it all.
abstract: Article on Jess Jackson, who owns fastest-growing and most successful wine-making business to appear in California in 20 years; says from few acres of grapes in early 1970's, Jackson now controls more than a dozen wineries--including his flagship, Kendall-Jackson--stretching from all the choice growing regions of California to Europe and South America; Jackson's empire is now among top 10 wine businesses in the country, with sales of about $200 million in 1996 from Kendall-Jackson alone; tables; photos (L)

headline.main: Californian Wins Middle Market and Ruffles His Rivals
headline.kicker: The Brash Prince of Wine Country
